summary: AAAC 2025, the 16th Annual Meeting of the Asian Association for Algorithms and Computation, will take place in Hong Kong, China, from May 31 to June 1, 2025. The conference focuses on theoretical computer science, especially algorithms and complexity. Keynote speakers include Yossi Azar and Eunjung Kim. The conference invites one-page abstract submissions (PDF format) via EasyChair. Key dates include a submission deadline of February 28, 2025, and early registration by April 25, 2025. Registration fees are 1800 HKD for normal and 900 HKD for student registration.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## Introduction
The 16th Annual Meeting of Asian Association for Algorithms and Computation (AAAC 2025) invites submissions of abstracts presenting original research or surveys of existing results in theoretical computer science. The meeting will be held at the City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, China on May 31 and June 1, 2025. This is a face-to-face event, and at least one author of each accepted submission is expected to register and present the work at the conference.

## Topics of Interest
All areas of theoretical computer science, with a particular emphasis on:

-   Design and analysis of algorithms
-   Complexity theory

## Important Dates

-   **Submission due:** February 28 (Fri), 2025 (AoE)
-   **Notification:** March 28 (Fri), 2025
-   **Camera-ready version due:** April 18 (Fri), 2025
-   **Early Registration due:** April 25 (Fri), 2025
-   **Conference Dates:** May 31(Sat) - June 1(Sun), 2025

## Submission Guidelines

Authors are invited to submit one-page (A4) abstracts in PDF format. These abstracts can be based on original research or surveys of existing results. Informal working notes including the one-page abstracts will be distributed at the meeting. Such distribution does not prevent future publication of the same work.

All submissions must be made electronically through the EasyChair Conference System:

[https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=aaac2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=aaac2025)

## Submission Types
Abstracts (one-page, PDF format)

## Best Student Presentation Award
The Best Student Presentation will be awarded. A paper presentation is eligible for the Best Student Presentation if the author who presents the paper is a full-time student. The award will be selected at the meeting by AAAC board members.

## Registration Fees

-   **Normal registration:** **1800 HKD**
-   **Student registration:** **900 HKD**
-   **Early bird registration:** by *April 25*

[Registration Link](https://www.hkws.org/registration/aaac2025/reg.html)

summary: The AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence is a leading international conference dedicated to advancing the field of AI. AAAI promotes theoretical and applied AI research and facilitates intellectual exchange among researchers and practitioners. The conference will be held in Singapore EXPO from January 20 to January 27, 2026. The conference features presentations of substantial original research and practices, along with panel discussions and invited talks addressing important social, philosophical, and economic issues related to AI.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) is a premier venue for the presentation of original research in all areas of artificial intelligence. The conference promotes theoretical and applied AI research as well as intellectual interchange among researchers and practitioners. The technical program features substantial, original research and practices.

## Topics of Interest

AAAI welcomes submissions on a broad range of topics in artificial intelligence, including but not limited to:

-   Machine Learning
-   Computer Vision
-   Natural Language Processing
-   Robotics
-   Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
-   Planning and Scheduling
-   Search and Constraint Satisfaction
-   Multiagent Systems
-   AI Ethics and Society
-   And more

## Important Dates

_Please refer to the official AAAI conference website for the most up-to-date and specific deadlines. Note that the dates provided below are placeholders and should be verified._

1.  **Submission Deadline**: [Insert Date]
2.  **Notification of Acceptance**: [Insert Date]
3.  **Camera-Ready Deadline**: [Insert Date]
4.  **Conference Dates**: January 20 - January 27, 2026

## Submission Guidelines

1.  **Format**: Authors should follow the AAAI conference format guidelines. Details on the format will be available on the conference website.
2.  **Length**: The maximum length for submissions is [Insert length, e.g., 8 pages] excluding references.
3.  **Submission System**: Papers must be submitted electronically through the conference submission system, the link will be available on the conference website.
4.  **Anonymization**: All submissions must be anonymized to facilitate a double-blind review process. Authors should remove their names and affiliations from the submitted paper and avoid any explicit references that might reveal their identity.
5.  **Review Process**: All submissions will undergo a rigorous peer-review process by experts in the field.

## Submission Types

AAAI accepts several types of submissions, including:

-   Full Papers: Presenting original research contributions.
-   Short Papers: Presenting preliminary results, novel ideas, or work in progress.
-   [Other Submission Types, if any, specify requirements here]

## Registration Fees

_Registration details, fees, and deadlines will be announced on the conference website. This section is a placeholder._

-   **Regular Registration**: [Insert Fee]
-   **Student Registration**: [Insert Fee]
-   **Early Bird Registration**: [Insert Fee] (Deadline: *[Insert Date]*)

>   *Note: Registration fees typically include access to all conference sessions, the conference proceedings, and any meals or social events organized by the conference. Check the official website for specific details.*

## Contact Information

For inquiries regarding submissions or any other aspect of the conference, please contact the conference organizers at [Insert contact email address or link].

summary: The 45th IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems (ICDCS) will be held in Glasgow, Scotland, from July 20-23, 2025. This premier international forum invites researchers and practitioners to present and discuss cutting-edge ideas in distributed computing systems. The conference seeks original contributions across various tracks, including cloud computing, distributed algorithms, edge computing, and more. Key dates include abstract registration by December 11, 2024, paper submission by December 18, 2024, and author notification on April 2, 2025. Accepted papers will be presented at the in-person conference, and a selection of papers will be considered for publication in IEEE TPDS. Authors should adhere to IEEE's ethics and AI policies. The conference will also feature a Civic Reception and Closing Ceremony on July 23rd at the historic City Chambers, with social events and tours planned for delegates.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## Scope
The 45th IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems (IEEE ICDCS 2025) is the premier international forum for researchers and practitioners to present, discuss, and exchange cutting-edge ideas and the latest findings on topics related to all aspects of distributed computing systems. The conference will be held from July 20-23, 2025, in Glasgow, Scotland, UK. We invite you to submit original contributions to IEEE ICDCS 2025.

## Topics of Interest
Papers can be submitted to one of the following tracks:

-   Cloud Computing
-   Distributed Algorithms
-   Big Data, Models & Systems
-   Distributed Fault Tolerance
-   Distributed OS and Middleware
-   Edge Computing
-   IoT + CPS
-   Mobile Computing
-   Security, Privacy and Trust
-   Blockchains/Databases
-   Distributed Systems for AI/ML
-   AI/ML for Distributed Systems
-   Deployed/Emergent Applications & Infrastructures

## Paper Submission
The Paper strand provides the opportunity for researchers to present their new state-of-the-art research in Distributed Computing Systems, which makes, or has the potential to make, a significant contribution to the field.

Papers must be original and unpublished and must not be submitted concurrently for publication elsewhere. All paper submissions should follow the IEEE 8.5″ x 11″ two-column format using 10pt fonts and the IEEE Conference template (downloadable by selecting “Conferences” in the IEEE-Template Selector [https://template-selector.ieee.org/](https://template-selector.ieee.org/)). Each submission can have up to eleven (11) pages (including figures, tables, appendices, and references). Papers exceeding this page limit or with smaller fonts will be desk-rejected without review.

The paper review process is double-blind. Authors are required to take all reasonable steps to preserve the anonymity of their submission. The submission must not include author information and must not include citations or discussion of related work that would make the authorship apparent. While authors can upload their paper to institutional or other preprint repositories such as arXiv.org before reviewing is complete, we generally discourage this since it places anonymity at risk. If authors decide to upload their paper to a preprint site, they must make sure that the title and abstract of their submission to ICDCS are different from the title and abstract of the preprint version, so that it is not immediately obvious that the two versions are by the same authors and with the same content. To encourage reproducibility, we encourage the authors, whenever it is possible, to include in their paper a link to an anonymised GitHub repository with all source code, scripts, and data needed for the reproduction of their results.

For each accepted paper, at least one author is required to pay a full author registration and attend the conference in-person to present their work on-site. Any no-show papers will be reported to the publisher and removed from the conference proceedings. For authors with multiple papers accepted by the conference, a separate author registration is required for each paper.

Note that the authors should adhere to ethic and professional standards of IEEE. Please refer to [IEEE Code of Ethics](https://journals.ieeeauthorcenter.ieee.org/become-an-ieee-journal-author/publishing-ethics/guidelines-and-policies/submission-and-peer-review-policies/#ai-generated-text) and [IEEE Policy of AI-Generated Text](https://journals.ieeeauthorcenter.ieee.org/become-an-ieee-journal-author/publishing-ethics/guidelines-and-policies/submission-and-peer-review-policies/#ai-generated-text).

Note: A set of highly selected IEEE ICDCS 2025 papers will be considered for publication in the IEEE Transactions on Parallel and Distributed Systems (TPDS). The selected papers will undergo an extension process, transforming them from their initial IEEE ICDCS conference format. These extended versions will then be subject to a review by an editor from IEEE TPDS.

## Important Dates (Time zone: Anywhere on Earth (AoE))

1.  Paper Abstract Registration: **December 4, 2024** (Extended to **December 11, 2024**)
2.  Paper Submission Due: **December 11, 2024** (Extended to **December 18, 2024**)
3.  Author Notification: **April 2, 2025**
4.  Camera-Ready Submission: **April 16, 2025**

## Submission

*   Paper Submission Website: [https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Feasychair.org%2Fconferences%2F%3Fconf%3Dicdcs2025&data=05%7C02%7CChristos.Anagnostopoulos%40glasgow.ac.uk%7C6772c2b874c4403e9f2b08dcc354d5c2%7C6e725c29763a4f5081f22e254f0133c8%7C1%7C0%7C638600016320696355%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NIhmRmg1GRSGaXJDn%2BKBvS%2FUOy17Qwi9zPNQP1p1jVg%3D&reserved=0](https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Feasychair.org%2Fconferences%2F%3Fconf%3Dicdcs2025&data=05%7C02%7CChristos.Anagnostopoulos%40glasgow.ac.uk%7C6772c2b874c4403e9f2b08dcc354d5c2%7C6e725c29763a4f5081f22e254f0133c8%7C1%7C0%7C638600016320696355%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NIhmRmg1GRSGaXJDn%2BKBvS%2FUOy17Qwi9zPNQP1p1jVg%3D&reserved=0) (Submission portal opens on 1 November 2024)

## Contact Information

For inquiries regarding the Call for Papers, email: [icdcs2025@easychair.org](mailto:icdcs2025@easychair.org)
